reviews.review: The more times I saw it the more I caught, whether that be jokes or references to the first movie, and the more I enjoyed the songs. It's separate enough from the first movie to be its own stand-alone but also has enough callbacks to tie it into that story.
We were evacuated due to a possible fire, so we didn’t get to watch it, but the first 15 minutes were great.
it was a fun movie, good plot, and enjoyable to watch
Classic Disney. Nothing else that needs saying...
The story was fun and original
Loved this movie so much. So much story and passed is explained.

Frozen II is just another sequel, a sequel who tries to live up to its predecessor it doesnt do anything special. It kind of fucks up a few characters, it made Olaf less funny and made him annoying. In the first movie, i laughed and giggled, but here its just like he was put in the movie just to sell toys. The plot was boring and the only appeal to me are the songs. So to me, this movie is just a waste of time and money

As usual the sequel fails to capture the magic of the original. It lacked depth in the story line, including a lot of plot holes, and it had too many main characters. I feel like they rushed it and came up with a poorly developed story line. Even the songs were disappointing. I was even more disappointed because Frozen 1 ranked up with my favorite all time Disney films, alongside Beauty and the Beast. I personally am not going to purchase Frozen 2 and am going to pretend this film didn’t exist. Honestly I’m probably being over critical because I anticipated something at least close to Frozen.

This movie was phenomenal!!  I thought the storyline was well done and the animation blew my mind.  There was incredible changes that were made.  From the tiniest details of the clothing to the rush of the waves crashing against the rocks.  I loved it!
My 12 yr old niece loved it. I thought the story had a lot of problems. Oh well, as I am not of the demographic they are aiming for, not my problem.
